text:
It would be handy if the DOMConfigurator could use the same sort of variable 
substitution as the PropertyConfigurator.

All that is required is a publicly accessible method on the DOMConfigurator 
that would allow the setting of the internal Properties object
eg
    public void setSubstitutionProperties( Properties substitutionProperties ) {
        props = substitutionProperties;
    }

(I have tried this & it works )

This would add flexibility to configuration when using the DOMConfigurator 
explicitly from client code
creator: bsommerville@redrock.com.au

text:
I'm not sure whether this really solves your problem but I managed to substitute
properties which are passed as parameter values in an XML log4j config file. It
looks something like this:

    <appender name="FILE_APPENDER_01" class="org.apache.log4j.FileAppender">
        <param name="File" value="d:/temp/${ee.process.log}"/>
        <param name="Append" value="true"/>
        <layout class="org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout">
             <param name="ConversionPattern"
		    value="%d %-5p [%t] %c{1} (%M:%L) - %m%n"/>
        </layout>
    </appender>

The param value "${ee.process.log}" is replaced when 		
System.setProperty("ee.process.log", Prozess.currentProzess.getLogFileName()) is
called before reading the XML file.
creator: mrfloppy_vid@gmx.de

text:
You (Ben Sommerville and Wolfram Kaiser) are both right. DOMCOnfigurator allows 
variable susbstitution through system properties but not from a properties 
object (or file) chosen by the user. 

DOMConfigurator will be replaced by JoranConfigurator in log4j 1.3. 
JoranConfigurator will cover this case. Ben, if log4j 1.3beta does not add this 
functionality please drop me or log4j-dev mailing list a note and we will 
fix/add it.
creator: ceki@apache.org
